result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca M Bray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, pay all applicable fees of supervision, pay mandatory DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole. All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail posted is to be applied to all monetary obligations. Any bail remaining after payment of all monetary obligations is to be returned to the person who posted.
No contact with victim, Cassie K. and co-defendant, Aimee Lynn Schemehorn.

Comply/cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by department of corrections, probation and parole.
Pay restitution in the amount of zero.
Civil judgment warning given.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Count 1 credit for 0 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca M Bray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Misdemeanor Battery - PTAC contrary to 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05, Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.
COUNT 2, AMENDED/ADDED as Disorderly Conduct - PTAC contrary to 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.05, Wisconsin Stats a CLASS B MISDEMEANOR.
  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 and AMENDED/ADDED COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 13 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 1. Credit for 0 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years, CONCURRENT to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION Apply to both counts unless designed otherwise: 
-comply/cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by department of corrections, probation and parole;
-complete 80 hours of community service (COUNT 1);
-no contact with victim, Cassie K. and Co-Defendant, Aimee Lynn Schemehorn;
-pay restitution in the amount of $ZERO;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge;  failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  Cash Bail Bond posted in this matter in the amount of $900.00 on  04-25-2014 is to be applied to all monetary obligations.  Any bail remaining after payment of all monetary obligations is to be returned to the person who posted.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM021873  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-22-14

Joint stipulation for $900 cash bail, and no GPS monitoring. Court granted.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Step Nolten for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Casie K., her family, residence, school or workplace.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
